item.title: The Morning After: Sony plans to bring its hit PlayStation series to smartphones
item.description: Today’s headlines: Alibaba hit with $2.8 billion fine in China antitrust case, Sony plans to bring its hit PlayStation series to smartphones and NASA delays Mars helicopter flight to at least April 14th.

item.title: Amazon's rotating Echo Show 10 drops to a new low price of $200
item.description: Amazon is offering its premium Echo Show 10 smart screen for $50 less as part of an all-time low deal on the Alexa-powered device.

item.title: Ducati backs away from electric motorcycle production plans
item.description: After saying in 2019 that it was "not far from starting production" on an electric motorcyle, Ducati is doing a U-turn on those plans.

item.title: Apple's 512GB MacBook Air M1 falls to an all-time low on Amazon
item.description: Amazon is currently offering the 512GB MacBook Air with Apple's latest M1 chipset for $1,149.

item.title: Google is shutting down its iOS and Android Shopping apps
item.description: Google is adding another entry to its app graveyard, and this time it's Shopping that's getting the guillotine.

item.title: Apple's upcoming iPad Pro could be scarce due to next-gen display shortages
item.description: Apple plans to introduce a Mini LED display on its flagship 12.9-inch iPad Pro, but the suppliers of that tech are apparently experiencing poor manufacturing yields.

item.title: VW teases larger ID.6 electric SUV ahead of auto show debut
item.description: VW has teased the ID.6 electric SUV ahead of a launch in Shanghai, and there have been significant changes since the Roomzz concept.

item.title: Google allegedly gave its ad system an advantage with a special project
item.description: Google ran an effort, Project Bernanke, that supposedly gave its ad system an unfair edge — and Texas intends to use this in its antitrust case.

item.title: Leak hints Samsung's Galaxy S21 FE will use a 'traditional' design
item.description: A reported Galaxy S21 FE leak hints Samsung's next value-for-money phone will sport a familiar but more conventional design.

item.title: Microsoft is reportedly close to buying speech tech giant Nuance
item.description: Microsoft is reportedly in late talks to buy Nuance for $16 billion, giving it advantages in speech tech and AI.

item.title: Last-minute battery deal keeps Ford, VW electric car plans on track
item.description: A last-minute settlement between two battery giants, LG and SK, may have saved EV production plans for Ford and VW.

item.title: Find lost items anywhere with these tiny Bluetooth trackers
item.description: Mu Tags attach to your essentials and allow you to locate them with an in-app map. You won’t have to worry about losing your belongings again with these attachable tracking devices.

item.title: One-chance assassination missions arrive in 'Hitman 3'
item.description: 'Hitman 3' now has one of the series' best-known features: just-one-chance Elusive Target missions.

item.title: Sony wants to bring 'popular' PlayStation game franchises to phones
item.description: Sony is hiring an executive to lead a PlayStation push into mobile gaming.

item.title: NASA delays Mars helicopter flight to at least April 14th
item.description: NASA has delayed the first flight of its Mars helicopter to at least April 14 after an issue during a test.

item.title: Biden's first budget proposal would fight chip shortages with US factories
item.description: The Biden White House's first budget proposal includes funding for domestic manufacturing to tackle chip shortages.

item.title: Feds charge man with planning to blow up an Amazon data center
item.description: The FBI has charged a Texas man with planning to blow up an Amazon data center in Virginia and help 'kill' most of the internet.

item.title: ICYMI: We check out the new Sonos Roam portable speaker
item.description: Here's a recap of all of Engadget's tech reviews this week, including those for the new Sonos speaker, OnePlus smartphone, Master & Dynamic earbuds and the Google Nest Hub.

item.title: Hitting the Books: How biased AI can hurt users or boost a business's bottom line
item.description: In 'A Citizen's Guide to Artificial Intelligence,' John Zerilli presents readers with an approachable, holistic examination of both the history and current state of the art, the potential benefits of and challenges facing ever-improving AI technology, and how this rapidly advancing field could influence society for decades to come.

item.title: The Morning After: The end of the line for Harmony remotes
item.description: Harmony's universal remotes are fading away, and there's a $699 Optimus Prime robot you should see.

item.title: Learn to play the piano at your own pace with Skoove
item.description: Skoove is a highly rated piano learning app suited for everyone from beginner level to advanced players. Take lessons generated by having an AI observe your skills or access the massive resource library for additional training.

item.title: Recommended Reading: Painful memories the algorithms won't let you forget
item.description: Recommended Reading highlights the week's best long-form writing on technology and more.

item.title: Firefox will soon stop supporting Amazon Fire TV and Echo Show devices
item.description: Mozilla is ending Firefox support for the Amazon Fire TV platform and Echo Show devices starting on April 30th.

item.title: Alibaba hit with $2.8 billion fine in China antitrust case
item.description: Chinese authorities have slapped Alibaba with a $2.8 billion fine after finishing an anti—trust investigation that looked into alleged monopolistic practices.

item.title: Logitech is done making Harmony remotes
item.description: Logitech is killing off its line of Harmony remotes, with the remaining devices available only 'while supplies last.'
